Reviews.Title: Great size for my Granddaughter
Reviews.Author: D. Foster
Reviews.Content: I was looking for an inexpensive camera for my 7 year old granddaughter.  This worked great.  She can easily use it.  It didn't take long to figure out how it works.  I just plug it into the computer to recharge the battery.

Reviews.Title: perfect little pocket cam
Reviews.Author: emperatrix
Reviews.Content: I just received my camera and am so glad I went with the whim to purchase it! The size is perfect for carrying around in my pocket or purse when I go out, the images are clear and crisp, and I am really impressed by the smart capture feature which seems to know exactly the right setting for your shot. Exactly what I was looking for.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: gloaming
Reviews.Content: I've owned this camera for about 10 days so far, and I've been pleased with its performance. It's definitely entry-level, with few bells and whistles, but it takes sharp pictures. Some of the reviews I read indicated that the photos taken in low-light situations weren't the greatest, but that hasn't been my experience at all. I have taken a few pictures while out on the town with friends, and the pictures came out perfectly well. The pics I took at an outdoor wedding last week were beautiful--the bride even asked me to send them to her for her album. Overall, the camera is easy to set up and use, and takes great pictures. For the price, it's a great little camera!

Reviews.Title: Pleasantly Surprised
Reviews.Author: AmerAussie
Reviews.Content: My 6 year old son had been asking me for a camera for about a year, so on vacation I gave in. He told me he wanted a blue camera and pointed to this one. I'm normally a researcher, but the price on this compared to other comparable or "better" cameras couldn't be beat. Boy am I impressed! This camera takes better pictures than the Nikon Coolpix I bought for my husband! Honestly! I started using this camera for all of our vacation pictures and just love it. I may not give it back to him. : )What I don't like is the software that comes with it. It is slow to load, freezes and gets touchy about which photos it will let you crop. You are better off using your choice of photo editing software, although it did do a decent job enhancing some of my more distant landscape shots. Don't buy it for the software, buy it because it's a great little camera at a great price.

Reviews.Title: cute but complicated
Reviews.Author: Laurencia "Eva"
Reviews.Content: This is the third Kodak camera I own ; this is the tiniest of all which is great; it is light and takes good pictures. The reason why I don't like it too much is that it is more complicated to use; the last small one had a small wheel on the top that made it easy to adjust it to close-ups etc. This one doesn't have that practical solution, it takes more time to find what you are looking for. Also it is more complicated a slower to transfer the pictures to your computer. I admit I am technically somewhat challenged but this is the type of camera that is supposed to be used by people like me.The price is good though and I hope it doesn't die on my too soon.

Reviews.Title: Somewhat of a basic model for Kodak
Reviews.Author: ginmar "book/digital addict"
Reviews.Content: Kodak, after Canon, is my favorite brand of camera, due to the sturdiness of the casing and the wonderful way they have in-camera programs which other cameras require you to do on the computer. You can edit videos on the camera, clipping out frames from video, and so on. If they just added extremely high speed video, I'd be ecstatic, because I love to shoot lightning storms and then clip out the best individual frames as stills. 30 frames per second is pretty slow when it comes to lightning. But enough about me. Like all Kodaks, this is sturdy, with excellent in-camera editing features such as panorama, video editing, touching up photos, and a variety of 'scenes', which is Kodak speak for different settings for different photo ops. It is absurdly, delightfully small---smaller than my blackberry. It's smaller than a deck of cards.  It's somewhat basic in comparison to my z1485, which is basically a tiny almost-SLR. But if you want a camera to grab as you're dashing out the door, this is it. A word on Kodaks: I went to Iraq and I wound up killing two cameras, or rather the heat did, along with the rough and tumble conditions. I think the heat is what fried them, literally, because on some days, it was 100+ by 9AM---in the shade. By noon it was unspeakable.  A friend gave me a floor model, used, from a store, and that camera got kicked around, subjected to the conditions that had killed the other two cameras, the heat, the dust, and the abuse, and though by the end of the tour I had to keep the battery compartment shut with a rubber band, it still worked just fine. When I got home I upgraded to another Kodak. I gave the old one---still equipped with the rubber band----to a soldier friend, who in turn took it to Iraq with her. It came back with her in fine shape but finally back home, it gave up the ghost, yet was in good enough shape to be sold for parts on Ebay. Its successor---the much beloved V505---went to friends when I upgraded from that one, and that too performed admirably till it got fried in an electrical incident. Every Kodak I've had---and I have three now---- are tough, small, and versatile. I'm very fond of them, and all they need to do now is to make a camera that has night vision and shoots at FPS1000.  That's all I ask. Until then, I've got these in my bag when I go out the door.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures in a compact size
Reviews.Author: Lincoln Reagan "The World is a Wonder"
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for my elementary aged daughter for her birthday. I had another Kodak, the M1033 and was happy with it. We used both on a recent trip, and when Dad (me) slippery-fingered the M1033 (larger one) and broke it, this Kodak Mini filled in admirably. My daughter took great pictures with it. It is not a "kids" camera, but is sized so they can used it effectively. Would recommend to anyone, and especially a parent looking for a decent camera that is not too expensive for their child.

Reviews.Title: Now, Taking a Versatile Camera Along is Never A Problem!
Reviews.Author: Privacy
Reviews.Content: It's exactly what I was looking for!  Excellent photos and small enough, and light enough, to put in a pants or shirt pocket and not bulge or feel heavy at all.  In fact, it's easy to not even think about the fact that I have a camera with me.  As for size, I can easily hold it in the palm of my hand.  This is the camera I want for everyday activities and where convenience matters.  I can just grab it, stuff it in a normal pocket, and go.  It's there for every candid or spur of the moment shot that I would have missed.I find this camera much more versatile, with many more features, than any cell phone camera.  And since it's so small and has so much more capability, there's every reason to take it along.  And it's certainly much easier to upload and share these photos.  The software works perfectly and is simple and straightforward.Okay, you get the idea I'm pretty happy with this purchase.  I can even take it with me on the bicycle, where normally I'm trying to get rid of every item and every bit of extra weight.  Get this camera and you'll never miss another shot!

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: TB
Reviews.Content: Amazing little camera.  Very light weight, tiny size.  I needed a smaller camera for my desert tour after my last one was damaged in a sand storm.  Inexpensive and easily fits in a pocket.  Purple isnt everyones favorite color but I dont mind that either.  Highly recommend for a young teen though...it works for what I need...hopefully it lasts longer than my more expensive one.

Reviews.Title: Cute Camera
Reviews.Author: Miller "Tricia"
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my 12 year old for Disney.  It is the perfect size for a child and takes great pics so far.  Should be a great Christmas surprise.

Reviews.Title: Good camera for teenager
Reviews.Author: Yulia B.
Reviews.Content: This is a small lightweight camera that suits my daughter just fine. She has been having a lot of fun with it lately. It works fine, easy to set up, operate and transfer pics to your computer.

Reviews.Title: Works well but can be fragile
Reviews.Author: Diane Hays
Reviews.Content: I am an Advanced Practice Nurse and I use the Mini M200 to take educational wound pictures at the hospital. It has done a very effective job in realistically photographing wounds that I blow up on the computer to make presentations to my fellow medical professionals. I especially appreciate the fidelity in the close-up shots I take of wounds. The compact design lends itself to this task because it is easy to carry and use without being a distraction. The only caveat I have had with the Mini M200 is it feels cheap and fragile. In regular use at the hospital, not a demanding environment for a camera, the protective battery cover popped off of the hinge and refused to snap back on. I have filed a repair request with Kodak and now I have to wait and see if they will repair the camera under the warranty. Other than this battery cover issue the camera has worked very well. If it had with a little more robust design and construction I would give this camera a 5-star rating but this problem holds the rating to just 4-stars.

Reviews.Title: Super disappointing
Reviews.Author: Sheila "Sheila"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my 9 year old daughter. She brought it on vacation and snapped over 400 photos.  Literally 5 were not blurry.  I realize a 9 year old wielding a camera is going to result in a less than perfect picture, so I tested it myself over several days. I took about 100 pictures and had a very difficult time getting a crisp image.  Of the total 500 combined pictures less then 10 were worthy of a 4x6 print.The battery life is horrible. The camera needs to be charged so often, it often was left behind because it wasn't ready to go.The shutter kept getting stuck open.There is no macro whatsoever. Don't even try.On the positive side, my daughter really liked the purple color. Its a little sparkly, she really thought that was cool.  The size is also really nice for little hands and to carry around.Unfortunately, we have returned this camera and are looking for something better. I'm really disappointed that we didn't try it before we left for vacation. Because we didn't, so she has hundreds of bad pictures and missed opportunities of the beautiful Oregon mountains and coast.

Reviews.Title: Nice Little Simple Camera
Reviews.Author: Karen E. Rice
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice little camera for basic snapshots. The size is excellent, fits in a pocket and is only a little thicker than a cell phone.  I am very happy with it and the image quality is decent for an inexpensive pocket point and shoot.  Will it take award winning photos? Maybe, if the conditions are right and if I know what I'm doing...but mostly this is perfect for snapshots, and casual photography.

Reviews.Title: KodakMini
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: Really good camera. I'm glad I bought it. I needed a camera that was easy to carry for those photo moments when I didn't want to take out my DSLR.

Reviews.Title: disappointed
Reviews.Author: Tracey Dill "momof7"
Reviews.Content: I buy all my products from amazon based on the reviews of others. I have to say my experience with this camera does not match the glowing reviews I had read. It is very small and the button used to take a picture is also very small. The downside to that is that it is very difficult not to shake the camera when taking a picture. I am an experienced photographer and have never had this problem with any other camera before. Most of my pictures turn out blurry as a result, rendering this camera a waste of money.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for my daughter
Reviews.Author: BC
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera as a gift for my daughter's 8th birthday.  She absolutely loves it!  The camera is small, so it fits her hands well (not mine though), easy to use, and red.  What else does one need in a camera for a young girl?  The battery charge seems to last quite a while, and is easy to recharge, so she shoots away without missing the side of a building, her shoe, or her smiling face from 6 inches away - need to work on some photography skills with her.  I would say this was a perfect gift for her.

Reviews.Title: very nice camera
Reviews.Author: nb30
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for my 11 yr old who wanted a real one and is a nice little camera that takes nice pictures for a good price.

Reviews.Title: Defective out of the box
Reviews.Author: NHalpern
Reviews.Content: I am a working mother, and I do not have time in my life for things that don't work straight out of the box.  Pretty camera, nice price, but when I loaded the battery and plugged the camera in, it wouldn't charge.  Note, the instructions are extremely simple, there's a little diagram on the camera itself that shows how the battery should go in and, moreover, the battery won't fit into the camera if the battery is oriented wrong; the end of the charging cord that goes into the camera can only go in one way because of the shape of the plug and the same thing is true for the other end that goes into the wall plug.  So, the problem was not user error.

Reviews.Title: Exactly what we needed; nothing more, nothing less
Reviews.Author: Grrgoyl
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my girlfriend last year for xmas.  My only criteria was the smallest camera I could find (for around $100 or less), because she loves taking pictures when she goes out running but hates carrying lots of bulky stuff.  Boy, this thing is unbelievably small, so mission accomplished there.  It's so small that handling it is almost tricky with adult-sized hands, but not too great a price to pay.She loves the clever tiny mirror on the front for self portraits.  It's all you need--don't waste extra $$ on a fancy front LCD screen. The battery life is really outstanding (even a year later), and the pictures are plenty sharp and clear enough for our needs.  The screen doesn't have any scratches on it a year later, despite doing nothing to protect it.Like other reviews have pointed out, no fancy bells and whistles here, just a solid, basic camera that gets the job done and is highly portable while doing so.  Would buy again without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: Great...as long as your subjects aren't moving
Reviews.Author: Gen
Reviews.Content: I teach 1st grade and bought this camera strictly so that I wouldn't have to constantly bring my personal camera back and forth to work. At first I thought it was ideal (great color, rechargeable battery, small size), but once I started taking pictures I realized that the kids had to be ABSOLUTELY still in order for the photos to not turn out blurry. Did I mention that I teach 1st grade? Yeah. It's a bit of a challenge to get a decent picture where no one is moving.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easy share mini camera
Reviews.Author: AC
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my daughter's 5th birthday and she loves it.  She wanted her own 'real' camera and this one is perfect for her.  She loves that it is purple and to me the price was reasonable for a decent little camera.  We have lots of great shots of her baby dolls and our dogs. :)

Reviews.Title: Decent
Reviews.Author: Jaymz
Reviews.Content: Not too bad for the price. Works great and has a good display. The photo's are nice and clear and stable, without motion blur.Only major complaint is that the battery life is extremely shorter than we'd like, working for only about an hour or so before it needs to be recharged.

Reviews.Title: Colors
Reviews.Author: L.W. "Lisa"
Reviews.Content: The camera colors that I ordered were "Red" and "Blue".  However, the "red" is really neon hot pink and the "blue" is really a bright baby blue.So, if you don't mind having a hot pink or baby blue camera then this is a decent choice; but don't be expecting a red camera because it isn't going to happen.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Lilylala2002
Reviews.Content: For the price, I think it was well worth it. It takes great pictures but yet it won't devestate me if I were to lose it on vacation!

Reviews.Title: nice toy
Reviews.Author: captron
Reviews.Content: just got my new mini, for what it is and for what i want it to do it's perfect. like someone said" where's the camera when you need one", well now i do, i will buy a few of these and justhave them in my other locations just for that reason. NO battery inventory, works easy. you can hand this puppy to anyone and they can use it right away. nice toy

Reviews.Title: really really love it
Reviews.Author: Henry Tudor
Reviews.Content: execellent camera for this cheap price. I purchased it for my daughters 6th birthday. she takes pictures and video all the time. i actually borrow it often bc of its great size and cool colorthis camera has been droped down 17 stairs, thrown and lost countless times but it keeps on goinggreat purchase

Reviews.Title: Good little camera
Reviews.Author: Joe in WV
Reviews.Content: I've had camera for four months after fooling around with AA batteries in my older digital camera.  Battery has held up very nicely.  Use camera for basic stuff and takes good pics.  Easy operation, good battery, fairly easy mod operation keys.  Worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera!
Reviews.Author: km
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera several weeks ago and LOVE IT!  The small size makes it very convenient to carry.  I can't believe how great the pictures are.  Even in poor lighting they turn out great!  I would highly recommend this camera to others.  I purchased a NEW camera and it came just as ordered.  The box had not been opened and the camera was in the original packaging.  I was very pleased with the fast shipping.  I received the camera way before it was promised.  I am very pleased!

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: christyj001 "Christy"
Reviews.Content: This is a tiny, basic camera that totally meets my needs for taking photos that I need for work.  It is small and compact, so that means the buttons are small as well, and that has taken some getting used to.  The picture quality is great.  There's no manual, only a "quick start" guide, which is really all that is needed since the camera operation and features are pretty basic. It does not come with a memory card, so be sure to purchase one if you want to take more photos than the internal memory will allow (about 20). Overall, a good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: Great for when you can't carry a full size camera with you.
Reviews.Author: T. Woodworth
Reviews.Content: The camera is nice and small making it easy to take on vacation or just about anywhere. The camera is makes it really easy to upload photos with the share feature. This camera also takes decent photos as long as the subject isn't moving. It's not a top of the line camera, but for times when you just need a nice little camera for site seeing or for vacation it is well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Flo "Flo"
Reviews.Content: This little camera takes surprisingly great pictures, even indoors.  The size is wonderful, fits right in the palm of your hand. Also the shutter lag is not that bad for a point and shoot which surprised me.  If you want a small camera to carry around that takes great pictures, this is the one. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Lillypad
Reviews.Content: Take great pictures, the action setting is the best, no smears or ghosts in any pictures.  Perfect for the price and fits in my pocket

Reviews.Title: Great basic camera
Reviews.Author: Rcc
Reviews.Content: We bought this for our 6 year old because she wanted a real camera.  For the price this was a great buy.  It does not come with the memory card.  It has been a lot of fun for our daughter.  Picture quality is pretty good and is probably better if you use the scenery settings.  Video quality is OK too.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: V. Hollmann
Reviews.Content: We got this camera for our grandson who is 10.  He is thrilled with it, loves that it is small enough to take anywhere in his pocket.  It takes great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Easy ...
Reviews.Author: Warren R. Keller
Reviews.Content: The Kodak Easy Share Mini M200 is easy to operate ... takes great photos ... Nice discount on the price ...It would be nice to have a better description (ie on board memory etc) ... All in all - Very nice.

Reviews.Title: Excellent little camera
Reviews.Author: SC1842
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my daughter in college.  She loves it.  I actually used it once and found it to be very easy to use.  It takes great photos and fits in her small purse (smaller than most point and shoot cameras - I guess that is why it is called a "Mini"!).  Also, it's very affordable.  I've tended to lean more toward Kodak lately - never had a problem with them; have rechargeable batteries; and affordable.  They also take good pictures.  Would highly recommend if you are looking for a very portable small point and shoot camera.

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: Zaid Novi
Reviews.Content: Before buying this camera I did a little research online and in stores, no other was as good as this one, the quality and price seem to fit my needs. I have own this camera over a month and i have not found any flaws yet, I just hope it keeps at it. I like that is small and fits perfectly on my busy purse,and of course i love the color purple, that is why i bought it.

Reviews.Title: Remarkable little camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "SMART  SHOPPER"
Reviews.Content: I love the little mirror on the front,worked out great for pictures of my and my husband on vacation. Also takes great close-ups. Wonderful addition to my larger camera.

Reviews.Title: Perfect purse camera!
Reviews.Author: SILVERSTAR120885
Reviews.Content: I love this little camera!  I have one of the huge and expensive DSLR cameras which I absolutely love...but when we go on little outings and stuff like that, I don't like to haul it around...it is inconvenient and I'm afraid it will get damaged.  This little camera is so tiny, but takes great pictures and videos and is just perfect to stick in a purse or diaper bag!  LOVE it!

Reviews.Title: A good "second camera."
Reviews.Author: MTSOfan
Reviews.Content: It doesn't measure up to my DSLR, but it's reliable and good to take in a sport coat pocket or book bag.  Simple operation -- not a lot of special features.It's especially good with macros.  I call this my "emergency camera."  Much better than my cell phone camera.

Reviews.Title: Little in size but big in quality
Reviews.Author: Barbara Stephens
Reviews.Content: I bought this for our Disney world trip. It is easy to carry due to the small size but the picture quality is great. It's amazing how technology has advanced. My big camera of 6 yr doesn't have this quality. I just keep it in my purse for those unexpected moments when I can snap the grandkids.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Hank "mnmusicfan"
Reviews.Content: I've used this on countless trips with the kids and it's perfect for everyday use.  The pictures are clear and nice, easy to upload and share.  I love that no battery is needed, we've spent so much money in the past on camera batteries but this you just charge like a cell phone.  I'd definitely buy this camera again.

Reviews.Title: Easyshare Camera.
Reviews.Author: Ralph  Mills, Jr.
Reviews.Content: Bought for a Christmas gift, so I will not know how it works until then.  Packageing was somewhat beat-up but was intact. Overall I am pleased.  Thank You.

Reviews.Title: excellent
Reviews.Author: javy&jenny; "Javy & Jenny"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my travels. It's cute! and I love it. It's small and you can take anywhere. the shipped was on time.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the price
Reviews.Author: EC
Reviews.Content: I've used it at many events, and even though it does not always focus on the right subject, it works well for what I paid.

Reviews.Title: Durable and easy to use
Reviews.Author: Frank S. "Scuddog"
Reviews.Content: Survived a 15 month tour in Afghanistan with me.  Great image quality and high MP when needed.  Massive SD card that I bought with this never runs out of room.  Even the video function is great in a pinch!

Reviews.Title: Kodak EasyShare Mini M200 10 MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Zoom
Reviews.Author: edinson
Reviews.Content: Haven't used it much yet, but so far I like the convience of the size - it comes in very handy when not much time to take pictures

Reviews.Title: very satisfied with my article for the good price and the quality he has is the best buy thanks alot
Reviews.Author: Vladimir Asencio
Reviews.Content: very satisfied with my article for the good price and the quality he has is the best buy thanks alot

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Ellen
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my teenage grandaughter who loves it.  Not only is it "cute" but the camera takes beautiful pictures and videos.

Reviews.Title: a very small and great camera
Reviews.Author: chocolatathunder
Reviews.Content: nice camera to have a definit;y good buy if you want a camera to fit into your pocket  fj ijeriofj  kwejf;l

Reviews.Title: Kodak EASY SHARE MINI M200 10 MP Digital Camera with 3X Optical Zoom
Reviews.Author: Faith Aunio
Reviews.Content: Haven't used it much yet, but so far I like the convience of the size - it comes in very handy when not much time to take  pictures

Reviews.Title: camara
Reviews.Author: keinzen2010
Reviews.Content: muy conforme con la compra recomiendo al vendedor de este producto, llego en perfecto estado y estoy conforme con la compra

Reviews.Title: Already Broken
Reviews.Author: Amber
Reviews.Content: I got this for my 12 year old.  She loved the color and the picture quality was good.  However, this is a fragile product.  I would not recommend it for kids.

Reviews.Title: In Some Ways Better Than I Expected!
Reviews.Author: Endre Johnson
Reviews.Content: I like how compact and handy this camera is! It also takes pretty good pictures! My only real complaint is that I wish the controls on the back of the camera were larger! The buttons can be difficult to press!

Reviews.Title: I love it and so does everyone else!
Reviews.Author: Joyce E. Ivory
Reviews.Content: I love my little mini Kodak easy share. I bought it for a great price. I don't think it's as cheap as I bought it for anymore, but I would pay up to $99.00 for it. Mine is red. I had to get red because purple my favorite color was more expensive at the time, and although I was tempted to get purple I went with the red, and it's a very pretty cherry red. What's more important is it takes beautiful pictures!!! I always look so cute and glam on the pics I take with this camera. I like it better than my iphone pics. It has some nice little features and it's very easy to use. The most important thing is that it's small. It's about the size of a credit card just thicker, but not too thick. I like that because it fits right into any small bag I might be carrying when I'm going out, and I can still fit my lipgloss and compact. Not excellent for taking pics far away, but beautiful close up and medium range shots...That's mostly what I do anyway. :)

Reviews.Title: Tiny camera win!
Reviews.Author: LizM74 "e_lizard08"
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a 'back up' camera for times that I didn't feel like dragging my Canon EOS Rebel around. I find that it takes very good pictures and video for it's size, and am very happy that I bought it. Very user friendly, lightweight and reliable. It is too bad that Kodak won't be making cameras any more!

Reviews.Title: great little camera
Reviews.Author: kathy
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera to take in kayak with me to get pictures of sunrises and sunsets.  Works great, small to fit in my lifejacket pocket.  Takes great pictures. Is very small so easy to handle. The video works well and had good sound with it. Very happy with this camera. Does as well as my bigger more expensive camera. Enjoy shopping on amazon, have never had a problem with any purchases.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera for the money
Reviews.Author: Al Mashburn
Reviews.Content: I have a couple of bigger digital cameras I really like, but I am going on a 4 day hike in the mountains, and wanted something not only lighter and smaller, but one that would fit in a small pocket on my backpack strap. This camera not only fit those requirements, but actually took pretty good pictures. The first few seemed out of focus, but I found if you let it sit in the "half down" mode on the button for a while, it would get it together, it just takes a couple of seconds to auto focus. This camera is a good deal for the money, you aren't going to get anything into a photo magazine, but it takes pretty good pictures for the money, is light, small, and very easy to set up and use.

Reviews.Title: Mini Cam with a big personality
Reviews.Author: JB5 "JB5"
Reviews.Content: This little guy comes in a small package but delivers giant delight.  Purchased for my daughter but trying to convince her to trade it to me in exchange for my expensive camera.  No go on that one.  She carries it easly in her pocket and it is so rugged it has held up under vacation torture, including the beach.  She won't use her top-of-the line camera feature on her phone anymore because the pictures are so bright and clear with the mini.  Everything is simple and auto settings are close to perfect. Switch from stills to video instantly but be sure to buy a good size storage card.  Share photos on line or copy to phone.

Reviews.Title: great!
Reviews.Author: anonymous
Reviews.Content: this was my first ever real camera, it takes excellent pictures, and the videos are just as good as the pictures are. the size was extremely convenient just slip it into you're pocket and you're A O.K. the zoom is really awesome, and even if you're in a really dark room, when you do flash it brightens up the room very much.if you are looking for a affordable priced camera that: takes really good pictures, convenient size, and lasts very long. than this is the camera you're looking for! i give it  5 stars.

Reviews.Title: Easy to care, even easier to use
Reviews.Author: Fourcats
Reviews.Content: I bought this product for my son who was going to Europe with a school group.  I wanted something inexpensive in case he lost it.  To my surprise it was a great little camera for the money.  It fits easily in a pocket or purse. I'd totally recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful
Reviews.Author: Ruthann H. Stetak
Reviews.Content: I love this camera paid less than a friend who got a re-furbished one!  Color is beautiful and pictures great.

Reviews.Title: great buy
Reviews.Author: Lorna
Reviews.Content: Cute little camera for my daughter. She loves the ease and size. The shipping was fast. It is easy to carry around because it's so small. Makes taking pictures fun and convenient.

Reviews.Title: small works great
Reviews.Author: Travis "Dont stop. Push harder.  Keep going."
Reviews.Content: I use this camera on my bike rides.  It takes quality pics as long as you make sure you focus and hold it still.  Sometimes get blurry pics, but I'm sure that it is user error.  The software it comes with is nice, you can plug the camera in to your computer and it automaticaly downloads all pics to a folder.  You can tag pics if you want and they will be posted when you do the download.  Great little camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for quick travel documentation; experimentation
Reviews.Author: McDesign
Reviews.Content: Great camera - we had a couple of older EasyShares years ago, and always liked them.For a trip to Europe we bought three of these in June 2012, in different colors, for our kids; also some 8 GB cards.  In three weeks, they took exactly (7,942) pictures, never using a case, just stufffed in a pocket.  Couple of falls from waist level to concrete or cobbles; no apparent damage.We had only one issue with any camera.  One lost the little internal retaining clip or spring that holds in the SD card, but the camera door held it engaged just fine.Charging from USB was handy off the laptop or supplied AC adapter; I hate AA or AAA batteries in cameras - they seem to last about a hundred shots.  Best day for one of these was (312) 10-MP shots with some battery left.The camera turns on very quickly - plenty of ability to whip it out as we were driving past something and get a good pic in time.The totally flat "closed" position makes it easy to slide in and out of a pocket or backpack strap.Pictures in decent light were great - inside a dim cathedral, the shutter speed was slow enough to blur occasionally.  The zoom is not much - 3x gets you some closer, but better to crop later in a photo-editing program.The panorama feature gave us some great shots of big vistas and cathedral ceilings - three seamlessly-stitched-together pix into one.I've got no reference to judge them from a photography standpoint - I'm just a casual picture-taker to record projects - but foor the purpose we used them for, they couldn't have performed better.<edit> - we also ordered a red one; got neon pink - not an issue for our youngest girl!

Reviews.Title: Wrong color twice!
Reviews.Author: J. Mitchell
Reviews.Content: I haven't had a chance to use the camera yet, since it has been shipped in the wrong color twice so I've had to return it both times. Love the look and size of the camera, and I thought it would be perfect for my son who is turning 8 in a few weeks. However, I have ordered it twice in red and received neon pink instead. So instead of getting his favorite color (red), I'll try to order it in blue this time. Looking back at reviews, I now see others have had this same problem with the red camera shipping in pink instead. (And BTW, this is NOT an ambiguous red/pink color issue. The camera I have received is NEON pink with a neon pink carrying case... there is no mistaking it for red!) Thanks to Amazon for the easy return policy, but it's still an annoyance and a hassle to have to return a product twice for the same mistake. If I ever get an acceptable color, I'll come back and update my rating to reflect the actual function of the product.

Reviews.Title: Good or Bad??Depends.......
Reviews.Author: Nour.najma
Reviews.Content: This product is a great product especially in everyday life and it's a very small camera and that is good.But if you're planning to buy the whole pack of the camera which is the wallet and the memory card with the camera you might be a little disappointed the wallet is actually very great a pretty color and very cute but after one day of the memory card use the camera started to get me disappointed it was so slow that the person posing can't pose anymore and you can't even close it fast it takes forever a trip to the zoo wasn't a great trip at all on a ride on the train in the zoo you cant capture the animal because it was too late. I finally experimented a little and fortunately found out I had another memory card at home and it worked perfectly and that there was something wrong with the new memory card. So i advise you to not buy some memory card that is 4GB and that costs only $4.00. The Camera price is actually very reasonable and cheap in a good way and the picture quality is awesome. If you are attached to this camera than take it because it's really great but just get the memory card from somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: The Best Little Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I needed a new camera and I like small things. The first thing that grabbed my attention was the size...as big as a credit card...and it is...you can put it in your pocket. This is nice because I travel alot and I like to travel light. The ease of use and the quality of the pictures exceeds expectations. It is user friendly...which is good because the user brochure that came with it does not provide anything except a diagram labeling the buttons etc...however...it was easy to figure out. I would also like to mention the EasyShare is just that...easy to post on social networking sites...overall for the money and the size this is a great little camera and I would recommend to buy.

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera
Reviews.Author: Joe
Reviews.Content: Had this camera about a month now. It takes good pictures for its size. Very light, easy to carry and seems well made. The rechargeable battery is a huge plus. The battery last a very long time. Overall I found nothing bad about this camera and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy
Reviews.Author: Navaro
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera from Walmart for $20.00 less which rarely happens.  I bought it just to have a camera with me in case of any car accidents. This is an incredible performing camera for its size. It is clear easy to use and the battery will last for about 900 flash shots and a 1 minute video. (At least it did for me.) It is very feature rich for such a small camera and is well worth the price even at FULL-price!

Reviews.Title: GREAT Compact, Easy to Use Kodak
Reviews.Author: katzluvr
Reviews.Content: This camera won't do many tricks and it's certainly not a professional DSL, but it's exactly what I was looking for!  Very compact and takes great pictures of friends and vacation spots, without being too complicated to figure out.  If all you want are good pictures for your own personal memories, I would highly recommend this camera!

Reviews.Title: AWESOME Little Camera
Reviews.Author: BB
Reviews.Content: This camera rocks!  It tkes great pictures with vivid colors and great deatails, it is very samll and easy to carry with you anywhere.  Love the panaromic pics.

Reviews.Title: no help
Reviews.Author: Mary Moseley
Reviews.Content: It is not for beginners.  ANd you have to invest in another card in order to use.  have it in a drawer

Reviews.Title: Driver No Longer Available
Reviews.Author: FrancesG
Reviews.Content: I bought the pink version, but I think this is common to all colors - Kodak no longer has the driver available so that you can access the pictures. I couldn't get in using Windows 7 Explorer - it just kept referring me to a web link that didn't work. Unless you want to use a memory card and read your photos directly from there, I'd avoid this product. I returned it.

Reviews.Title: Swacoe
Reviews.Author: Sandy Williams-Coe "Swacoe"
Reviews.Content: Love this little camera and the pics are great.  Fits anywhere and always carry a camera now.  Shipper shipped out very quick.

Reviews.Title: caught unprepared!!!
Reviews.Author: J. Clark
Reviews.Content: Now that I've bought a 16GB SDHC hi-speed card AND a battery charger K7700 for this camera, I love it!  As an inexperienced digital camera user, I didn't realize the camera itself would only hold 10 (ten) pictures!!!  I was so excited about getting the camera in time for Easter, when it failed me fast.  I fault the DESCRIPTION of the camera for this.  It might have made a difference in my decision.Most of the instructions are written with the assumption you already know how to use a digital camera.  Nothing for rank beginners like me.Overall, I really like it.  It's lightweight & small & easily carried in my purse or pocket.  It takes decent pictures, which I hope with time will improve as I gain more experience.One other thing which I don't particularly like is that the USB cord & power cord are one & the same.  To solve this problem, I bought a battery charger K7700 from Kodak, which comes with a 7006 battery, so I could have a charged battery at all times.  I don't think the K7700 advertised on Amazon comes with a battery - at least I couldn't find any description that said so.Now I've spent about $150 (my upper limit) on this camera, when I was so thrilled about finding it at $89.  That's disappointing.  Chalk it up to inexperience.  Next time I'll know what questions to ask.

Reviews.Title: havent used it yet
Reviews.Author: heather
Reviews.Content: i bought this as a christmas present so it hasnt been used. It came on time tho and was exaclty what i wanted and what i expected

Reviews.Title: WARNING: Uses PRICEY special Kodak cable
Reviews.Author: Magpookie
Reviews.Content: The camera works ok for it's size. Good at taking closeups and ok in other situations. Not too great in low light areas. I had to take several shots to get one good photo but I guess it's decent for the price. HOWEVER, this camera uses a special micro usb 5-pin cable. I called Kodak and they were out of stock and told me to go on Amazon to order it. If you search on Amazon you'll see it's pricey and sometimes not compatible. $17 cable for a $70 camera???? Ridiculous. This is the first Kodak camera I've purchased and it will be the last. I'll stick to Canons and Nikons.

Reviews.Title: Feels basic and cheap - just as it is
Reviews.Author: KM
Reviews.Content: Feels just the way it is: basic and cheap.Pictures are OK but with very little control. Takes poor quality pictures in evenings. Flash is not very powerful. Everything is set automatically but not optimally - I could get much better results if I could adjust ISO, shutter speed, etc.Generally I'd prefer to spend $20-$30 more on a much better camera.However, this was a gift for someone who used a 5-year old barely working camera, thus they were happy with this one.

Reviews.Title: Display does not work.  Return!
Reviews.Author: jtay
Reviews.Content: Seems like a really nice camera.  I like the small size, however, the color is different from what is pictured (received dark blue instead of light blue) and the display DOES NOT WORK.Can't use a digital camera without the display.  Returning this disappointment today.

Reviews.Title: Gabriel
Reviews.Author: Gabriel
Reviews.Content: lo recomiendo 100% articulo muy funcional. . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .

Reviews.Title: I love this..
Reviews.Author: Y. Cho "Mike"
Reviews.Content: This is what I have been searching for. I had canon camera. It's ok, but it's expensive and thick. I move around a lot and single so I needed something very tiny I can put it in somewhere in my bag and never know I am carrying. The only thing available like that small was old sony cyber shot. The price went up after it's discontinued and it's merely 2mb photo. So, I was searching and then I found this camera coming out. I was so thrilled. I grabbed it since it was on sale. I would have paid 99 dollar cuz there is nothing like this. So, I couldn't be happier. I took some photo and the photos are better than I could ever expect. I have had kodak before. I didn't like it. I didn't like canon either. Pictures weren't that good. It was dark and it looks like they want to make the picture pretty rather than crisp and lively. This one does that. I like it a lot. It's so so small and light. It's almost like children's toy but it's not. It has all the function that normal people would want and it's fairy easy to operate. I loved HP camera. It's so so so easy to operate and there is like no button but the round navigation button and on and off, but, it's ok. This one is near easy. I don't need such and such function. I like just shot and go. The picture is definitely better quality than canon. My canon is cheap one but more than double of this camera's price. what a bargen. Thank you thank you Kodak. I wish they make portable printer. Portable is ripp off and many many people would want to hands on. They now making printer but it's so bulky like every other printer makes. Somehow they make it big. I guess people at the office like big ones, but it's not for me at home. It was going to become smaller at some point but then it got bigger again. They figured it sell better when it's bigger? Down side is small portable ones becomes rip off. They can just put any price and we don't have choice but to buy big one for a cheap or pay extra extra for small ones but they look like they could be switched. Small ones cheap and bigger ones expensive because bigger ones has much more function and have LCD! I hate that. They switch price. :(

Reviews.Title: Nice size but doesn't work
Reviews.Author: jessthafacts
Reviews.Content: I bought this item a few days ago. It was delivered to my house within two days of ordering it. I love the size and would love the camera even more if it actually worked without having to charge it. Without having the camera hooked up to my computer or the wall, it is pretty much useless. Hopefully I can get another battery that actually works with it. I guess that's what I get for trying to save a few bucks.

Reviews.Title: Wrong Color
Reviews.Author: T. Davis "Davister"
Reviews.Content: I ordered seven of these cameras, which were to be distributed at a professional event. According to the listing and my invoice the cameras were supposed to be red. Upon opening one of the boxes, I was shocked to see a neon pink camera with a neon pink and yellow case. The other six boxes also had neon pink cameras! I would be the laughing stock of the event if I handed those out...Hopefully I get this issue resolved or else I'll have to pray that the recipients have a sense of humor...

ProductInfo.Features:
Insanely small credit card sized styling makes it irresistible to take along wherever you go
The cool little mirror on the front makes framing self-portraits and group shots so much fun
3X wide-angle optical zoom allows everyone to get in the shot
One-button upload of pictures from your PC to e-mail, KODAK PULSE Display and other popular social networking sites
Take amazing HD quality pictures in 16:9 format then view your pictures in high definition on an HDTV or other HD devices
ProductInfo.Name: Kodak EasyShare Mini M200 10 MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Zoom and 2.5-Inch LCD - Purple
